name: Powdery Mildew (Cucumbers)
symptoms: White powdery spots on leaves, stems, and flowers
precautions: Ensure good air circulation around plants
cure: Apply sulfur-based or potassium bicarbonate fungicides.

name: Apple Scab
symptoms: Olive-green or black spots on leaves and fruit
precautions: Prune trees to improve air circulation
cure: Use fungicides like captan or myclobutanil.

name: Bacterial Leaf Spot (Peppers)
symptoms: Water-soaked spots on leaves that turn brown
Small, sunken, black spots on fruits
precautions: Avoid working in the garden when plants are wet
cure: Apply copper-based fungicides to reduce the spread.

name: Downy Mildew (Basil)
symptoms: Yellowing leaves with fuzzy, gray-purple undersides
cure: Apply fungicides containing mefenoxam or phosphorous acid.

name: Fusarium Head Blight (Wheat)
cure: Use fungicides containing prothioconazole or tebuconazole.

name: Smut (Pearl Millet)
cure: No cure once infected; prevent with seed treatments.

name: Botrytis Blight (Roses)
symptoms: Gray, fuzzy mold on flowers, leaves, and stems
precautions: Remove dead or diseased plant material
cure: Apply fungicides containing iprodione or chlorothalonil.

name: Dutch Elm Disease
symptoms: Dark streaks in wood under bark
precautions: Control bark beetles that spread the disease
cure: Fungicide injections may help if caught early; often fatal.

name: Phytophthora Root Rot (Rhododendron)
cure: Apply fungicides containing mefenoxam or fosetyl-aluminum.

name: Cactus Anthracnose
symptoms: Yellowing and dieback of affected areas
Orange or pink spore masses in wet conditions
cure: Remove infected parts; apply copper-based fungicides.
